ovdesc.p: Each record represents a ledger or statement item and , if it is matched, points to the matching item.

desc.p: This field contains the Account Officer code and may be used by a department to indicate the officer responsible for chasing differences between Statement and Ledger items.
4 character Account Officer Code
This field contains the value date of the item.
No Input allowed Standard T24 date format (Populated by the system when the item is created)
Reserved for future use
No Input allowed
Reserved for future use
No Input allowed
This field contains the statement number from which this item was generated. This will normally be sequential but may be reset on a daily basis.
No Input allowed (Populated by the system when the item is created)

This field contains the actual amount of the item. When the item is a 'split', this field indicates the real amount for this item and the ORIGINAL.AMOUNT field contains the amount before the split occurred.
No Input allowed Standard amount format (Populated by the system when the item is created)
This field contains the information to the Account Owner that is received along with the item line on a S.W.I.F.T. statement
No Input allowed (Populated by the system when the item is created)
Reserved for future use
No Input allowed

This field may contain the key of the item to which this item should be matched. The field is only ever populated from the manual statement input porcess and allows the user to create a matching entry to one selected from the unmatched list.
No Input allowed (Populated by the user when the item is created)
This field contains the Supplementary Details for the item.

When no reference for the Account Owner is available, ie, field ACC.OWNER.REF contains NONREF, the Account Servicing Institution should provide the best available alternative information in this field.
Supplementary details may be provided when an advice has not been sent for a transaction, or to provide additional information to facilitate reconciliation.
No Input allowed (Populated by the system when the item is created)
Identifies any additional element which has been defined locally to meet a particular requirement.

As in the majority of T24 Applications, the User is allowed to define in the Item file up to 999 Local Elements in addition to the standard fields previously specified. These Local Elements should be defined by the User where deemed necessary according to local practice.

The name(s) of the new element(s), as well as the Format and
Validation Rules:, must be defined in the LOCAL.TABLE, prior to the creation of any Item records.

Up to 35 characters as defined in the Local Table definition for this Local Reference field. Multivalue field. (Optional or Mandatory Input according to definition in LOCAL.TABLE for this Local Reference element)
As defined by the User within the LOCAL.TABLE and LOCAL.REF.TABLE.
Reserved for future use
No Input allowed

This field contains the funds code consisting of the third character of the currency code, if needed. (This field is optional on S.W.I.F.T. statements and where it exists, is extracted for reference only)
No Input allowed (Populated by the system when the item is created)
Reserved for future use
No Input allowed

This field is used to record the amount over or under the defined tolerance within which this item occurred. This field is populated when an item is manually matched and used for internal purposes only.
No Input allowed For internal use only (May be populated by the system when the item is matched)
Contains details of any overrides applicable to this item.
Conditions where overrides will be required include the following:
Item split created
Excess cents transferred to excess cents bucket
Matching fields do not match (eg. Value dates different, Transaction types different etc)
No Input allowed (Populated by the system when overrides occur)
This field contains the item for this account into which the amount in the EXCESS.CENTS field is deposited. Each account may have 4 excess cents buckets ie.
account.WE.CREDIT account.WE.DEBIT account.THEY.CREDIT account.THEY.DEBIT
which will contain an accumulated total of the excess cents for the account.
NB. The term 'cents' is simply used to indicate the smallest denomination for a given currency.
No Input allowed For internal use only (May be populated by the system when an item is matched)
This field contains a single character indicating the Debit/Credit mark for the item. When received via S.W.I.F.T. , the content may be one of the following :-
D = Debit C = Credit RC = Reversal of credit (debit entry) RD = Reversal of debit (credit entry)

Where the entry is a reversal (i.e. RC or RD), this field will contain the character indicating the entry (e.g. if RC field will contain D and if RD field will contain C) and the reversal indicator will be set to Y.
No Input allowed Field content 'C' or 'D' only (Populated by the system when the item is created)
Reserved for future use
No Input allowed
Represents the reference number to uniquely identify a particular item
The item keys is made up of 2 components delimited by a dot (ie. '.') :-
Account Number Item Sequence No.

This is a 27 character field made up of the following components delimited by a dot (ie. '.') in the format :- Account No. = 1-16 characters (valid account number) Item Sequence No. = 10 characters (sequential and numeric) eg. Standard key = 0000012345.0000006789
This field contains the amount of the item when originally generated. It will only ever be populated if the item has been 'split' when matched.
No Input allowed Standard amount format (Updated by the system when the item is created)
Reserved for future use
No Input allowed
This field contains the date that the item was matched.
No Input allowed (Populated by the system when the item is matched)
Identifies the sub account number of the NR.ITEMS under the master account
Help Text for this field is unavailable. Please refer to the T24 User Guides for further information.
Reserved for future use
No Input allowed

This field contains the Statement or Ledger mnemonic which indicates where this item originated. Outgoing statements generated by T24 are referred to as the Ledger side, whereas, incoming statements from S.W.I.F.T. are referred to as the Statement side. The field content will either be 'S' or 'L'.
No Input allowed (Populated by the system when the item is created)
This field contains the original item ID if this item has been 'split' when matched.
No Input allowed (Updated by the system when the split item is created)
This is a free format field allowing the entry of notes/comments. Additionally, it may be used to indicate that an item has been automatically generated by the system (only when a split is created).
Free format field (May be updated by the system when the item is created)

This field contains the key of the item that this item is matched to. Within the manual matching application, when an item key is entered into the MATCHED.ID field, the UNAUTH.MATCH.ID field of the record whose key has been entered in the MATCHED.ID field is updated with the key of this item.
(eg.)
Record AccA.001 Record AccB.002 --------------- --------------- MATCHED.ID = AccB.002 MATCHED.ID = blank
UNAUTH.MATCH.ID = blank UNAUTH.MATCH.ID = AccB.002
This field is only populated while the match is unauthorised and will be removed either upon authorisation or if the match is revoked.
No Input allowed (Populated by the system while the item match is unauthorised)
This field contains transaction type identification code for this item. When received via S.W.I.F.T. the content may exist in one of three ways :
1. For entries related to S.W.I.F.T. transfer instructions and subsequent charge messages:
Format: Snnn

The last three characters will indicate the message type of the S.W.I.F.T. message causing the entry (for debit entries) or the message type of the S.W.I.F.T. message used to advise the Account Owner (for credit entries).
2. For entries related to payment and transfer instructions, including related charges messages, not sent through S.W.I.F.T. or where an alpha description is preferred.
Format: Naaa
The last three characters must be one of the following codes, indicating the reason for the entry:

BOE Bill of Exchange BRF Brokerage Fee CHG Charges and Other Expenses CHK Cheques CLR Cash Letter/Cheques Remittance COL Collections (used when entering a principal amount) COM Commission DCR Documentary Credit (used when entering a principal amount) DIV Dividends Warrants EQA Equivalent Amount ECK Eurocheques FEX Foreign Exchange INT Interest LBX Lock Box1. LDP Loan Deposit MSC Miscellaneous RTI Returned Item SEC Securities (used when entering a principal amount) STO Standing Order TCK Travellers Cheques TRF Transfer VDA Value Date Adjustment
3. For entries being first advised by the statement (items originated by the Account Servicing Institution):
Format: Faaa
The last three characters must be an appropriate code indicating the reason for the entry (i.e. the codes listed above).
No Input allowed (Populated by the system when the item is created)
Reserved for future use
No Input allowed
This field contains a single character indicating whether this item was originally a reversal of a debit or credit. The content will either be 'Y' for a reversal and 'N'or blank when not a reversal.
No Input allowed (Populated by the system when the item is created)
This field contains the page number of the statement from which this item was generated. This will normally be sequential and will be reset per statement.
No Input allowed (Populated by the system when this item is created)

This field allows entry of the ID of the item to which this item is being matched. This may either be entered from the Statement or Ledger lists of unmatched items or may simply be entered by entering the sequence number of the ID.
Multi-value field Upto 27 characters of item key May be entered without account number (will be assumed from main item)
Reserved for future use
No Input allowed
This field contains the entry date of the item. When received via S.W.I.F.T. the entry date is in reduced ISO form and is expanded to standard T24 date format.
No Input allowed Standard T24 date format (Populated by the system when the item is created)
This field contains the Account Servicing Institutions Reference
The content of this field is the Account Servicing Institutions own reference for the transaction.

When the transaction has been initiated by the Account Servicing Institution, the Account Servicing Institutions reference may be identical to the Reference for the Account Owner. If that is the case, this field may be omitted.
No Input allowed (Populated by the system when the item is created)
This field contains the reference for the Account Owner.
At least one valid character other than a blank must be present.

For debit entries, the purpose of this field is to identify, to the Account Owner, the instruction which caused the debit. Therefore, the content of this field is the Senders Transaction Reference Number of the original instruction.
Credit entries may be the result of one of the following situations:

1. The Account Servicing Institution is identifying, to the Account Owner the receipt of funds for its account as a result of a related transaction. In this case, the content of is the Reference for the Beneficiary of the related transaction.

2. The Account Servicing Institution has issued a payment instruction to the Account Owner and the credit identified in this field is for that payment. The content of the field is the Transaction Reference Number of the payment instruction issued by the Account Servicing Institution.

If no reference is available for this field, the code NONREF will be used. The Account Servicing Institution must then supply, in the Supplementary Details field, what it considers to be the best alternative information.
No Input allowed (Populated by the system when the item is created)
This field contains the currency code of the account to which this item refers.
No Input allowed Standard currency format (Populated by the system when the item is created)
Help Text for this field is unavailable. Please refer to the T24 User Guides for further information.
